Kufungua mkataba wa Up/Down, utahitaji:

  • Chagua soko unalopendelea na mali ya biashara.
  • Chagua aina ya Up/Down unayotaka kufanyia biashara (Kuinuka/kuanguka; Kuinuka Sawa/Kuanguka Sawa; Juu/Chini).
  • Weka vigezo vingine vya hiyari vya mkataba.
  • Chagua muda wa mkataba.
  • Weka dau lako au kiasi kinachowezekana cha malipo.
  • Fungua mkataba wako.

526128866:
Malipo kwa kila pointi inaonyesha malipo utayo pokea kwa kila pointi juu au chini ya bei ya ukomo (ambayo huchaguliwa kabla ya kuingia mkataba) ndani ya muda wa mkataba.Kiasi hichi kitategemeana na dau lako.

Kwa Options, malipo kwa kila pointi yanaonyesha kiasi cha malipo utachoongezewa kwa kila pointi chini ya bei elekezi ya ukomo, mkataba utakapo tamatika.

Tafadhali kumbuka kuwa malipo haya hayatokuwa sawa na uwezo wa faida. Utapata faida pale ambapo kiwango cha malipo kimezidi dau uliloweka.

1288451130:
Mikataba ya Reset Call/Reset Put inatoa ofa ya kuweka upya bei ya ukomo kwa kiwango kinacholeta faida zaidi. Katika mkataba huu, utabiri wako wa soko ni mikataba yako ya bei ya kujitoa dhidi ya bei iliyoweka upya (badala ya bei ya kuingia). Aina za mkataba wa Reset pia kawaida hutoa asilimia ya chini ya malipo ikilinganishwa na mikataba ya Rise/Fall.

Wakati huo huo, mikataba ya Rise/Fall inazingatia bei ya kutoka kwa mkataba dhidi ya bei ya kuingia, kulingana na utabiri wako wa soko.

Kwa mikataba ya Juu/Chini, malipo stahiki huwa kati ya 1% mpaka 3,900% ya dau lako, kulingana na kizuizi kilichowekwa.

Ili kuingia na ukitumia suluhisho la ukwasi wa Deriv Prime na huduma ya biashara, utahitaji kufata mchakato
  1. Maombi ya akaunti: Wasiliana nasi na uungane na timu ya usaidizi bora kabisa kukusaidia katika safari yako yote ya kuingia.
  2. Uthibitishaji: Kidhi mahitaji yote ya kufata ikiwa ni pamoja na kujua mahitaji ya biashara yako.
  3. Akaunti ya margin: Weka fedha kwenye akaunti yako ya margin ili kufikia salio la chini kulingana na mpango wa kibiashara.
  4. Uunganisho: Jiunganishe na jukwaa letu kwa kutumia njia unayopendelea kuunganishwa.
1720812007:
Up/Down options zimegawanyika katika aina mbili:

Mikataba ya Inuka/Anguka, ambapo unaweka utabiri wa soko kwenye mikataba ikiwa bei ya kutoka imepanda au imeshuka mwishoni mwa kipindi cha muda wa mkataba. Ikiwa unafanya biashara na Ruhusu mahitaji sawa, unatabiri kuwa bei ya kutoka kwa mkataba pia inaweza kuwa sawa na bei ya kuingia.

Mikataba ya Higher/Lower, unaweka kizuizi kabla ya kufungua mkataba wako na kufanya utabiri wa soko ikiwa bei ya mali ya msingi ni ya juu au chini kuliko kizuizi kilichopangwa mapema mwishoni mwa kipindi cha mkataba.

-1677166916: How does Reset Call/Reset Put work?
-760230569:
A Reset Call/Reset Put option provides the opportunity for the contract's entry price (also known as the strike price) to be reset automatically at the midpoint of the trade duration if the underlying asset's price moves favorably with your market prediction.

The reset spot price is set at the precise midpoint of the total trade duration. For example, if you enter a 10-hour Reset Call option, the reset would occur at the 5-hour point, and the price at that exact 5-hour mark becomes the reset spot.

If the reset spot is beneficial based on your market prediction, it replaces your original entry price (or strike price). For it to be beneficial, the reset spot needs to be:

  • -lower than the entry price for a Reset Call contract, or
  • -higher than the entry price for a Reset Put contract.

Your potential payout will then depend on whether the underlying asset's exit price is higher for the reset spot price (for Reset Call) or lower than the reset spot price (for Reset Put).

If the reset spot price is less favorable, your original contract terms remain in effect (which means, it is the contract's original entry price that is considered). The reset is automatic, but whether it is applied depends on which price (original or reset) is more optimal for a potential payout.
-1610904880: Durations for Reset Call/Reset Put contracts range from 5 ticks to 120 minutes (2 hours).
-867968226: In Reset Call and Reset Put trades, "reset" refers to the condition where the strike price is reset at the midpoint of the trade duration. This happens if the market is moving in the opposite of your market prediction. When this happens, the contract will compare your predicted direction against the reset price instead of the original spot price at the contract's expiry.

The predicted payout is actually based on the barrier that is selected.

If the selected barrier is far from the current price of the underlying instrument, the probability of the spot price touching the barrier in a "Touch" contract is lower compared to a "No Touch" contract. In this scenario, the potential payout amount for a "Touch" contract is higher.

If the selected barrier is close to the current price of the underlying instrument, the probability of the spot price touching the barrier in a "Touch" contract is higher compared to a "No Touch" contract. In this scenario, the potential payout amount for a "Touch" contract is lower.

The potential payout and loss (your initial stake) amounts are clearly displayed before you open the trade.
-1047993307:
The price barrier in Touch/No Touch contracts refers to the specified price level that the underlying instrument's price needs to touch or not touch during the contract duration.

It acts as a reference point to determine the trade's outcome.

The potential payout percentage varies and depends on the barrier level selected as well as the probability of the condition being met at any time during the contract duration.

When you purchase a contract, you’ll pay a stake (also known as an option premium). This is the cost of entering a vanilla options trade.

If your market predictions are right within the contract period, you will receive a payout that is equivalent to the asset’s movement when the contract ends (or upon early termination).

If you decide to manually terminate the trade early (before the contract’s expiry), you will be charged an additional exit fee. Please note that it is not possible to terminate a contract with less than 15 seconds before expiry.
